summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary interview conducted by DOJ OIG Special Agents with a BOP Unit Manager (referred to as Mr. N) on September 22, 2021, as part of the investigation into the death of Jeffrey Epstein. The interview focuses on the events of August 9, 2019, specifically the phone call Epstein was allowed to make on a legal line, the failure to provide him a cellmate after his previous cellmate was transferred, and general operational failures and security lapses at the MCC.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at the center of the investigation. The interview details his request for a phone call, the circumstances of that call, and the failure to provide him a cellmate on the day of his death.

persons.name: Mr. N
persons.context: The witness being interviewed. He was the duty officer on August 9, 2019, who authorized and facilitated a phone call for Epstein on a legal line. He discusses BOP procedures, security lapses, and his actions that day.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: A former cellmate of Jeffrey Epstein. The witness references an alleged assault incident between Tartaglione and Epstein that led to Tartaglione being moved and investigated.

persons.name: Captain T. Noel
persons.context: A captain at MCC. The witness discusses possibly speaking with him about authorizing Epstein's phone call and mentions he was present late on August 9th.

persons.name: T. Noel
persons.context: A correctional officer in the SHU. The witness instructed her and another officer to ensure Epstein's phone call ended after 15 minutes and later called to confirm.

persons.name: M. Thomas
persons.context: A correctional officer in the SHU present during Epstein's phone call. The witness also speculates about his potential actions when discovering Epstein.

persons.name: Warden Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: The warden of MCC. The witness mentions her authority to approve special phone calls for inmates on restriction.

persons.name: AW T. Krueger
persons.context: An associate warden. The witness sent her an email timeline and pictures of Epstein's body from his personal phone.

persons.name: Unit Manager T. Shea
persons.context: Epstein's normal unit manager, who was on leave. The witness states it was her responsibility to set up Epstein's phone account.

persons.name: Counselor A. Alvarado
persons.context: Part of Epstein's unit team. The witness mentions her as someone Epstein would have requested phone setup from.

persons.name: R. Kelly
persons.context: Referenced by the witness as an example of another high-profile inmate who had his phone account properly set up, unlike Epstein.

events.title: Epstein requests and receives pack and pin
events.description: Epstein encounters Mr. N and requests help setting up his phone account (pack and pin) because his unit manager is on leave. Mr. N provides him the paperwork on either Wednesday, August 7th or Thursday, August 8th.

events.title: Epstein's final phone call
events.description: At approximately 6:45 PM, Mr. N escorts Epstein from an attorney conference to the G-tier shower in SHU. Using a legal line, Mr. N dials a (347) number for Epstein, who said he was calling his mother, but a male answered. Mr. N left at 7:00 PM, instructing officers to end the call after 15 minutes.

events.title: Epstein found deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. He is later pronounced dead.

events.title: Mr. N writes memo and sends body photos
events.description: Mr. N writes a memorandum detailing the events of August 9th. He also uses his personal phone to take pictures of Epstein's body at the hospital and emails them along with a timeline to Associate Warden Krueger, later deleting them.

events.title: Previous OIG/FBI interview of Mr. N
events.description: Mr. N was previously interviewed by the OIG and FBI regarding the Epstein matter, as referenced in the 302 report discussed during this interview.

events.title: OIG Interview of Mr. N
events.description: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducts a voluntary, sworn interview with BOP Unit Manager Mr. N at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.

locations: Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC), Brooklyn, New York
G-tier shower, Special Housing Unit (SHU), MCC
keyFacts: Epstein was allowed to make a 15-minute 'social' phone call to a (347) number on a legal line, which is not recorded, despite telling staff he was calling his mother. A male answered the call.

Epstein's cellmate was transferred out of MCC on the morning of August 9, 2019 (listed as WAB - With All Belongings), leaving Epstein without a cellmate, contrary to his required status. The witness states responsibility for replacing the cellmate lay with the SHU lieutenant/captain, not the unit team.

The witness admits that using legal lines for inmate social calls was a common, improper practice at MCC due to staff shortages and lack of proper procedures. He later instituted corrective measures like logbooks and removing legal line access.

The witness took photographs of Epstein's deceased body at the hospital with his personal phone and sent them to an Associate Warden before deleting them, citing a desire to document the body was secure.

The witness speculates that the officer who found Epstein may have entered the cell alone against policy and might have caused further harm in a panicked attempt to resolve the situation, though he has no evidence of foul play.
